channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report X-2024020866
item.description:
Report X-2024020866

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-01
  • City: MISSOURI CITY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found leaking during preload. Pkg may have not been facing with orientation arrows upwards The area was temporarily evacuated and absorbent mats was used to clean up the spill. At discovery, the pkg was immediately taken to the hazmat processing area. DescribePack: Leaking from top of can. No clips seen. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package handlers were told what to do when a hazmat leaks. They were retaught how to properly load hazmats with orientation arrows upwards. Absorbent mats were used for cleanup.

item.title: Report X-2024021039
item.description:
Report X-2024021039

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It appears tape failed on the bottom of packaging. While unloading the package bottom opened up causing inner contents fall out. (1) plastic Gallon bottle of Lime-B-Gone landed with cap side down causing it to crack and spill some contents. QA was notified and removed package to Hazmat cage utilizing all appropriate PPE to include, Gloves, goggles and face mask. DescribePack: Tape on the bottom of the package gave way under the weight of items causing one of the bottles to fall on the cap causing it to crack DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Item was immediately picked up and placed upright to minimize amount of spillage.

item.title: Report X-2024020156
item.description:
Report X-2024020156

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A specification cargo tank 1,000 gallons or greater containing any hazardous materials that (1) received structural damage to the lading retention system or damage that requires repair to a system int
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Responded to Argon residue IAPX 1093 releasing vapor from the valving cabinet on the tank car. Removed the seals and opened, Finding the liquid valve not completely closed allowing residue to leak by the less then tool tight cap. Closed the Valve And applied seals to keep it secure. Tightened The secondary securement cap. Leak had stopped cabinet resealed and train released.

item.title: Report X-2024020387
item.description:
Report X-2024020387

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was IB Scanned and sent into the overhead sorter, it was diverted to the ADM and due to weight came down chute and shot off the rollers and hit the ground and spilled on the admin that was working the area. This was reported to management. spilled contents swept up and placed in plastic Hazmat bag and tote for containment. DescribePack: there is a large crack at the upper portion on the plastic pale. It is about 3inches in length.1 DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in hazmat bag and tote

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Steel drum unloaded and transported to vanline via tugger. QA Admin saw leakage before processing it on the Vanline. HazMat certified operator was called to handle the material properly for damage process. DescribePack: Steel drum dropped from trailer to conveyor causing dent, puncture, and leaking base of cylinder DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Steel drum placed in Hazardous waste bag into FedEx approved Haz tote.

item.title: Report X-2024020277
item.description:
Report X-2024020277

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-09
  • City: VICTORIA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024020277 SequenceEvent: IB scanner noticed a spill in belly of the trailer. Notified unload OPM and OPM saw it was a hazmat. OPM placed Hazmat in a tot and placed in hazmat cage. OPM and Ops admin cleaned up spill and damaged package. DescribePack: Plastic drum cracked along the side of drum. 9" crack ran along the side of the drum. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Placed in tot and placed in hazmat cage. X-2024020274 SequenceEvent: IB scanner noticed spill in belly of trailer. Notified OPM of spill and OPM noticed it was a Hazmat. Upon inspection drum had cracked and leaked in belly of the trailer. OPM took damaged hazmat to Hazmat cage and OPM and OPs admin worked on damaged packages and clean up. DescribePack: Plastic drum cracked DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: OPM put drums in tots and moved to hazmat cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Inbound trailer unload on preload, Segregated package was sent to QA for Inspection. Inspection found one missing 1 gallon jug and 3 - 1 gallon jugs with loose lids. DescribePack: The package was wet due to leakage of contents. The side of the package torn and ruptured. DurationRel: 7 and MitigateEffect: The package was secured in a plastic tote with a double bagged liner. Then relocated to the QA department.

DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was in a tote when found and placed in a salvage drum for transport to Hazmat area.

item.title: Report I-2024020014
item.description:
Report I-2024020014

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-27
  • City: DFW
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: QATAR AIRWAYS CARGO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A package was tendered by forwarder DHL to Qatar Airways in DFW under MAWB 157-89110081 declared as consolidation. Actual contents were medical equipment and accessories per HAWB description which contained lithium ion batteries. It was not booked as an ELI shipment as it was supposed to but had an ELI label and PSN written on package. Upon acceptance and build up GHA where house staff failed to notice the ELI label and the PSN. As a result it was manifested and forwarded as general cargo on flight QR730/24Jan DFWDOH. Upon arrival of flight in Doha, it was discovered as a undeclared battery shipment. Shipment was held in Doha until proper documents were furnished to match package contents and labeling. Report filed with local CAA.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS DAMAGED IN TRANSIT. COMING OUT OF THE TRAILER THE PACKAGE WAS MISHANDLED AND LOADED ON ITS SIDE CAUSING CAPS ON THE CONTAINER TO LOOSEN AND BEGIN TO LEAK. PACKAGE WAS SENT TO THE QA STATION FOR INSPECTION AND REPACKING. DescribePack: PACKAGE DAMAGED DUE TO LOOSEN CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WET CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A BAG FOR INSPECTION AND RERPACKING.

item.title: Report X-2024020219
item.description:
Report X-2024020219

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-08
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX WAS LEFT OUTSIDE OF HWPA, BAGGED, IN A RED TOTE. DescribePack: NOT IN ORIGINAL BOX. ORIGINAL LABELS WERE TAPED ONTO A REGULAR SHIPPING BOX. BOX HAD SEVERAL LEAKAGE SPOTS. INSIDE, 2 OF THE 4 BOTTLES WERE TAPED OVER AND HAD MOISTURE WITHIN THE TAPE. UNDER THE TAPE, THE CAPS WERE LOOSE. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: DAMAGED BOTTLES WERE BAGGED AND SEALED WITH ZIP TIES BEFORE BEING PLACED IN A LINED 20 GALLON SALVAGE CONTAINER.

item.title: Report X-2024020201
item.description:
Report X-2024020201

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-07
  • City: HUTCHINS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When hazmat team arrived the package was placed in black tub. On inspection, the package was wet on one corner. Once the package was open, the leakage was traced back to one of the Rapicide PA Part A. The remaining three jerricans was not damaged and are still in good shipping condition. DescribePack: The jerrican was leaking through the tiny hole on the cape. It leaks every time it's tilted to the side the cap is on. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA placed the package in a bag and placed it in a black tub until hazmat team arrive.

  • City: FORT WORTH

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The unload manager noticed the package was leaking and put it in a damaged hazmat tote. The package was then given to me to take to the damaged hazmat processing area. DescribePack: Both of the 5 Liter cans have been dented on the side. One more so than the other. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The Package was separated from other packages to prevent the spread of damage.

item.title: Report E-2024020145
item.description:
Report E-2024020145

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 30, 2024, one (1) 3-gallon pail of paint was punctured in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel overpacked the damaged container in one (1) 55-gallon drum as waste. The crew then utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to further remediate the site. All paint-impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for future disposal.
